title: @SmashGizmo - Olaf is incredibly weak because you removed his defense and offensive capabilities.
body:
1). Removing the Health Scaling on his True damage is the main culprit to olaf's lack of success. Building Items on Olaf is pointless because he doesn't do enough damage to warrant it. This means playing Olaf is pointless because he doesn't exert the kind of pressure needed to truly  carry games as olaf.  

What's the point of building tanky on olaf if you do no damage? All you bring is a slow. You don't have any real CC outside of that. 
What's the point of building damage on olaf if you can't survive long enough to do the damage you built for? You have no way of getting in range quickly enough to deliver your damage.

So you'd think there's some kind of middle ground. But there's not. There are no items olaf can build that allow him to live longer AND do more damage. Either these type of items don't do enough damage, or they don't let him live long enough. 

And the icing on the cake was losing much of his offensive capability in all aspects (lower true damage, no armor penetration, minimum range on Q) and then you took away his defense when he ults (which by the way, makes no sense. No other champion is like that, and 6 seconds if being immune to CC isn't some end all be all ultimate, you're just picking on Olaf. Or your design views on Olaf are really really bad).

Like when I play Olaf, I don't feel good about it anymore. He has too many challenges to overcome to win a game.

replies.body: I have to completely disagree. I have been having fantastic success against all my lane opponents as olaf. He is a monstrous lane bully, I have been able to completely shut down most traditional lane bullies like renekton, Ryze etc. The fact is I have too much sustain as olaf compounded with the absurd damage on his e, and I will shove you out of lane or you will die. I have easily 1v2'd the enemy laner and jungler coming out alive because of his passive. I will always get a BotRK and then go full tank. And while it is true that I won't be able to insta-burst anyone down that isn't my job. My job as olaf is to stick to the enemy adc and make their life a living hell, which is easily done with the BotRK.
the problem is not winning lane 1v1 with olaf...the problem is doing something in teamfights other than getting kited/blown up if you´re not already ridiculously far ahead.
And if you're ridiculously far ahead, you steamroll the enemy team because they can't kill you. Riot really wanted to keep Olafs ultimate intact, but at the moment he can't be balanced with it.

Olaf player here. While lately i am not having a good ti
me in enemy tf's, i don' t agree that he is unplayable right now.
Even while under my worst skill condition i managed to win a lot of lanes, thanks to his E and his incredible sustain; many times i trolled the enemy by haging with low health and then throwing a W+R that annihilated them.

I also like his ultimate: while it is rough work it' s good to devastate the enemy carry, and with the tradeoff that it brings it just means you don' t have to use it lightly: engage with the passive and pop it in order to pop adc' s head!
He can compensate his lack of engagement in many ways, mainly Boots of swiftness/BotRK/Mallet ( it still exists!).

Also: what E scaling? he never had one before now as far as i know, even before the rework; now  it scales with AD ( in case you build a bit of it since, y' see, loads os AS ) and mostly reduces cd with auto attacks. On a crazed berserkerman that has innate AS steroid + as passive. Even if it does not nuke, what matters? huge peel and huge dps on the way.

There is still the problem with dashers/blinkers that make olaf engage an hell, but well i guess every champ has is pros and cons right?
